04/02/2010~~~food for thought~~~FAMILY IS IMPORTANT TO CHRIST...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
He said to His mother, "Dear woman, here is your son," And to His disciple,
"Here is your mother." From that time on, this disciple took her into his home.
(Jn. 19:26, 27)

Our Lesson for Today:
Even while dying on the cross, Jesus was concerned about His family. He instructed
John to care for May His mother. Our families are precious gifts from God, and we
should value and care for them under all circumstances..

Neither Christian work or key responsibilities in any job of position excuse us from
caring for our families. ~ The question we should ask ourselves each day should be,
"What can I do today to show my love for my family???

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, remind me that You care for me as a family member.
AND remind me also that I have a very important responsibility
in caring for my family...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Even while dying on the cross, Jesus was concerned about His family. He instructed John to care for May His mother. Our families are precious gifts from God, and we should value and care for them under all circumstances. Neither Christian work or key responsibilities in any job of position excuse us from caring for our families. ~ The question we should ask ourselves each day should be, What can I do today to show my love for my family???
original_verse_text: He said to His mother, Dear woman, here is your son, and to His disciple, Here is your mother. From that time on, this disciple took her into his home.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the precious gift of family that You have entrusted to us. Even in the midst of great suffering, may we follow the example of Your Son, who cared for His own family with tender love and concern. Help us to prioritize our relationships, to honor and cherish our loved ones, and to demonstrate genuine affection for one another, as Your Word instructs. May our homes be filled with the sacrificial love that reflects Your heart. We ask this in the name of Jesus. Amen.
reflection: Even while dying on the cross, Jesus was concerned about His family. He instructed John to care for Mary, His mother. Our families are precious gifts from God, and we should value and care for them under all circumstances. Neither Christian work nor key responsibilities in any job or position excuse us from caring for our families. The question we should ask ourselves each day should be, "What can I do today to show my love for my family?"
subject: Cherish Your Family, Even in Trials
verse_text: He said to His mother, Dear woman, here is your son, and to His disciple, Here is your mother. From that time on, this disciple took her into his home.

04/03/2010~~~food for thought~~~HE SUFFERED FOR ME...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
(Jesus cried) "My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?" (Mt. 27:46)

Our Lesson for Today:
Jesus was not questioning God; He was quoting the first line of Ps. 22 ~ 
it was a deep expression of the anguish He felt when He took on the sins of the world, 
which caused Him to be separated from His Father.

Can I hear Jesus' cry of anguish and ever think lightly again of Sin? ~ 
Can I ever again fool myself into thinking that God might deal more lightly with Me 
than with His Son? ~ Better still, do I find rich comfort in Jesus' cry of anguish? ~ 
Do I hear my savior saying: Because God forsook Me, He won't forsake you. ~ 
Because God punished Me, He won't punish you. ~ Because God crushed Me under 
His anger, He will raise you up in love. ~ Because God rejected Me, He will receive 
you as His very own"?

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to never think lightly of my sins again.
Help me to hear the cry of Your Son from the cross, and
remember the price He had to pay for my sins...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Jesus was not questioning God; He was quoting the first line of Psalm 22 ~ it was a deep expression of the anguish He felt when He took on the sins of the world, which caused Him to be separated from His Father. Can I hear Jesus' cry of anguish and ever think lightly again of Sin? ~ Can I ever again fool myself into thinking that God might deal more lightly with Me than with His Son? ~ Better still, do I find rich comfort in Jesus' cry of anguish? ~ Do I hear my savior saying: Because God forsook Me, He won't forsake you. ~ Because God punished Me, He won't punish you. ~ Because God crushed Me under His anger, He will raise you up in love. ~ Because God rejected Me, He will receive you as His very own?
original_verse_text: (Jesus cried) "My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, reflecting on the anguish and separation that Your Son, our Savior, experienced on the cross. We are humbled by the weight of sin that He bore, and we are reminded of the gravity of our own transgressions. Yet, in the midst of this pain, we find comfort in the knowledge that because You forsook Him, You will never forsake us. Because You punished Him, You will not punish us. Because You crushed Him under Your anger, You will raise us up in Your love. We are grateful for the salvation that You have provided through the sacrifice of Your Son. Amen.
reflection: Jesus was not questioning God; He was quoting the first line of Psalm 22 ~ it was a deep expression of the anguish He felt when He took on the sins of the world, which caused Him to be separated from His Father. 04/04/2010~~~food for thought~~~EASTER'S VICTORY...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
But Christ has indeed been raised from the dead. (I Cor. 15:20)

Our Lesson for Today:
On Good Friday the battle seemed lost. The promised "Seed of the woman" 
had breathed His last. Secret followers hurriedly deposited His lifeless body 
in a cold tomb. And hell's victory bash began...

Until Easter Sunday! ~ The champion sent by a loving God to fight for us is
no longer dead. ~ "Christ has indeed been raised from the dead." Hell's
victory celebration has been dimmed ~ replaced by the moans and groans
of those eternally damned. But you and I celebrate with holy joy...

Yes, we still fall into sin. Satan still sends out his sneaky patrols to identify
and bloody us in the weak spots of our faith. ~ But not to worry, Easter has
given us victory! ~ Like a reader who has skipped to the last chapter, we 
know the outcome. ~ Christ has been raised from the dead. He has paid for 
our sins..."Christ has indeed been raised from the dead." "He lives to silence
all my fears; He lives to wipe away my tears."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to live in the assurance of Easter's
all-out victory every day...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Satan still sends out his sneaky patrols to identify and bloody us in the weak spots of our faith. ~ But not to worry, Easter has given us victory! ~ Like a reader who has skipped to the last chapter, we know the outcome. ~ Christ has been raised from the dead. He has paid for our sins."Christ has indeed been raised from the dead." "He lives to silence all my fears; He lives to wipe away my tears."

prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that Christ has indeed been raised from the dead, as Your Word declares. Though the battle seemed lost on Good Friday, Your Son's resurrection has secured our victory over sin and death. By the power of Your Spirit who raised Jesus from the grave, may we walk in newness of life, no longer enslaved to the fear and despair of this world, but filled with the hope and joy of eternal life in Christ. Amen.

04/05/2010~~~food for thought~~~LIFE TO THE FULL...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"I have come that they might have life, and have it to the full" (Jn. 10:10b

Our Lesson for Today:
So swiftly life speeds by. So quickly it carries us to that gravestone with our
names and two dates on it. ~ And between those two dates, only a dash to 
represent a short interval called life. ~ Is that all there is? If so, life's nothing 
more than a cruel joke, some dismal hoax, played on helpless mortals by an 
unfeeling deity. ~ If so, then better to have it over with quickly or to have never 
lived at all...

But, Easter says, ~ "He is risen." ~ the grave is only the station where the 
believer's soul catches the early train while the body waits for the final train 
on the Last Day. It's not "good-bye" but "see you later" we speak to departing 
believers as we await the reunion with them in heaven..

"He is risen," Easter says. But while He leaves us here on earth, it's not just that
we might earn and eat, entertain and enjoy ourselves. Our daily, joyful mission is
to live for Him and to shine with the light of Easter that others might stand in the 
light also...

Yes, life on earth speeds by, but life in heaven lasts forever. And it's mine through
the risen Jesus...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You, Lord, for showing me the full life
in the risen Savior...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

May we not fear the grave, but look forward to the reunion with our departed loved ones in Your eternal presence. Amen.

10/06/2010~~~food for thought~~~RESURRECTION MEDICINE...

Our Bible verse for Today:
The disciples were overjoyed when they saw the Lord...(Jn. 20:20)

Our Lesson for Today:
Oh how afraid we can be of death! ~ We don't like going to the doctor because
we're afraid he might find something that will end up killing us. We don't like talking
about diseases such as cancer or heart trouble because they can often be fatal.
Medicine that comes in a syringe or in a bottle may help keep us alive, but not forever.
We need resurrection medicine...

Where can we find it? The same place the disciples did that first Easter."They were 
overjoyed when they saw the Lord." For them resurrection medicine came in the form 
of the living Lord. ~ For us it is the written Word. ~ The saw the risen Jesus in person;
we can see Him with the eyes of faith. Through the Word He stands before me, just 
as surely today as He did before the disciples in the locked room. Through the Word
He speaks His promises of sin pardoned, death put to flight, and heaven flung wide
open just as surely to me as to those first believers...

We can get this resurrection medicine through regular dosages of His Word...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, fill me regularly with Your life-giving Word...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

04/07/2010 (Wednesday)~~~food for thought~~~TIME TO GO TELL OTHERS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Mary Magdalene went to the disciples with the news: "I have seen the Lord!"
And she told them that He had said these things to her...(Jn. 20:18)

Our Lesson for Today:
Can we even faintly imagine how her steps flew back to Jerusalem? OR how
she pounded on the locked doors of the disciples' room? OR how her words
tumbled out: "He's alive I have seen Him. He's our risen Jesus, our eternal Savior
our ever lasting King"?

Joyfully she must have repeated every treasured word the risen Lord had spoken
to her. So whom have you told? ~ With whom will you share to joyous news of Easter?
We have such good news, and there are so many who still need to here it...
But remember before you can tell others, you need the joy that Mary felt when she saw 
her risen Savior...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, continue to fill me with the joy of this blessed Easter season...Amen
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

We have such good news, and there are so many who still need to here it. But remember before you can tell others, you need the joy that Mary felt when she saw her risen Savior.

Help us to proclaim with boldness that Jesus, our eternal Savior and everlasting King, is alive forevermore. May our lives reflect the transforming power of the risen Christ, that others may come to know the hope and salvation found in Him. Amen.

04/08/2010 (Thursday)~~~food for thought~~~TEACH ME TOO LORD...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
And beginning with Moses and all the prophets, He explained to them what
was said in all the Scriptures concerning Himself...(Lk. 24:27)

Our Lesson for Today:
What a Bible Class that must have been! ~ The teacher was the Lord Jesus. ~ 
The students - - two Jewish peasants. ~ the time - - the first Easter afternoon.
The theme - - Jesus Christ is the heart of all of Scripture...

The risen Savior walked those two Emmaus disciples through the Old Testament
Scriptures. ~ Everywhere He led them, they found His redemption of sinners.
"These are the Scriptures that testify about Me," He once said (Jn. 5:39)
Now He taught those disciples how the humility of Christmas, ~ the pain of Calvary, ~
and the victory of Easter had been foretold by Moses and all the prophets...

Why did the risen Savior use Scriptures that day with those disciples? ~ Why
didn't He just point to Himself and ask them to believe? ~ Don't you think He
was trying to tell us something? "Don't you want to sit in my Bible class?"
He was asking."Then go to My Word. It testifies about Me."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear risen Lord, take me deeply into Your Word so that I 
may always know my Savior...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

As He walked with the disciples on the road to Emmaus, open our eyes to see Him revealed throughout the Old and New Testaments. 04/09/2010~~~food for thought~~~BELIEVING IS SEEING...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Then Jesus told them, "Blessed are those who have not seen and yet
have believed." (Jn. 20:29)

Our Lesson for Today:
Some people think they would believe in Jesus if they could see a definite sign 
or miracle. ~ But Jesus says we are blessed if we can believe without seeing.
We have all the proof we need in the words of the Bible and the testimony of 
believers.~ A physical appearance would not make Jesus any more real to us 
than He is now...

Luther wrote, "We should be careful not to follow our eyes. We should rather close 
our eyes and open our ears and hear the Word."

Paul put it even better, "We live by faith, not by sight" (2 Cor. 5:7). And Peter perhaps 
said it best of all, "Though you have not seen Him, you love Him; and believe in Him and 
are filled with an inexpressible and glorious joy" (1 Pet. 1:8)...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, give me the eyes of faith to see You in Your word
as my living, all sufficient Savior...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Some people think they would believe in Jesus if they could see a definite sign or miracle. ~ But Jesus says we are blessed if we can believe without seeing. We have all the proof we need in the words of the Bible and the testimony of believers. ~ A physical appearance would not make Jesus any more real to us than He is now. Luther wrote, "We should be careful not to follow our eyes. We should rather close our eyes and open our ears and hear the Word." Paul put it even better, "We live by faith, not by sight" (2 Corinthians 5:7). And Peter perhaps said it best of all, "Though you have not seen Him, you love Him; and believe in Him and are filled with an inexpressible and glorious joy" (1 Peter 1:8).
original_verse_text: Then Jesus told them, "Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that true faith is not dependent on physical sight, but on the testimony of Your Word and the witness of believers. Help us to close our eyes to the world's demands for signs and miracles, and instead open our ears to hear the truth of Your Son, Jesus Christ. May we, like those who have gone before us, love and believe in Him without seeing, and be filled with the inexpressible and glorious joy that comes from walking by faith, not by sight. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Some people think they would believe in Jesus if they could see a definite sign or miracle. ~ But Jesus says we are blessed if we can believe without seeing. We have all the proof we need in the words of the Bible and the testimony of believers. ~ A physical appearance would not make Jesus any more real to us than He is now. Luther wrote, "We should be careful not to follow our eyes. We should rather close our eyes and open our ears and hear the Word." Paul put it even better, "We live by faith, not by sight" (2 Corinthians 5:7). And Peter perhaps said it best of all, "Though you have not seen Him, you love Him; and believe in Him and are filled with an inexpressible and glorious joy" (1 Peter 1:8).
subject: Believe Without Seeing: the Blessing of Faith

04/10/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE SAVIOR AND ME ALWAYS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
And surely I am with you always, even to the end of the age...(Mt. 28:20b)

Our Lesson for Today:
What a promise the risen Savior left us."Surely" He began meaning,
"Note this and note it well."I am with you," He continued. Not just His
words or His memory, but He Himself, the risen Conqueror of sin and
death, will be at our sides...

Also take note of the little word "am." Not "I was with you, but that may
change," ~ but ~ "Am, right now and always." "With you," He went on.
With whom? ~ Believers, of course, His disciples of all times, as His next
words show. ~ "With you always," ~ He promised, not just today and
tomorrow, but each day as He would give it."To the end of the age," He
concluded. ~ Yes His promise and presence will hold true until the end of history...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, stand at my side and keep me standing beside
You every one of my days and in Your eternal day...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Not "I was with you, but that may change, " ~ but ~ "Am, right now and always." "With you, " He went on. With whom? ~ Believers, of course, His disciples of all times, as His next words show. ~ "With you always, " ~ He promised, not just today and tomorrow, but each day as He would give it."To the end of the age, " He concluded. ~ Yes His promise and presence will hold true until the end of history.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the precious promise of Your Son, our risen Savior, who has assured us of His abiding presence with us, now and always, until the end of the age. Help us to cling to this truth and find comfort and strength in the knowledge that You are with us, guiding and sustaining us each day. May we live in the light of Your constant companionship. Amen.

Not just His words or His memory, but He Himself, the risen Conqueror of sin and death, will be at our sides. Also take note of the little word "am." Not "I was with you, but that may change, " ~ but ~ "Am, right now and always." "With you, " He went on. With whom? ~ Believers, of course, His disciples of all times, as His next words show. ~ "With you always, " ~ He promised, not just today and tomorrow, but each day as He would give it."To the end of the age, " He concluded. ~ Yes His promise and presence will hold true until the end of history.

04/11/2010~~~food for thought~~~MY BLEEDING SHEPHERD

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I am the Good Shepherd. The good shepherd lays down 
his life for the sheep...(Jn 10:11)

Our Lesson for Today:
A certain pastor was calling his sermon title for the church notice in the newspaper.
He dictated, "The Lord's my shepherd." ~ "Is that all?" asked the secretary on the 
other end of the line."That's enough," replied the pastor. ~ Imagine his surpass when 
he opened the Saturday newspaper and read his sermon's title: "The Lord's my shepherd.
that's enough." 

But oh how true! Jesus is the only shepherd we need. No one else can do what He did...
He laid down His life for you and me. He thought of us when the agonies of Gethsemane
pushed His soul into the dust. Of us He thought when the scourging cut His back. Of us
He thought when the crown of thorns pierced His brow, and when the nails pinned Him
to the tree...

It's not enough for me to simply to say, "Jesus is a good shepherd." Not even enough 
to state, "Jesus is the Good Shepherd." When I by God's grace can say, "Jesus is my
Good Shepherd," Then I really have something. Then I have the gigantic difference
between peace and turmoil, salvation and damnation, heaven and hell. Then I have the 
only shepherd I ever need...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank You for bleeding and dying for me...
Thank You for giving me the faith to call You my Good Shepherd...
Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

04/12/2010~~~food for thought~~~MY SEEKING SHEPHERD

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus used this illustration as a demonstration of God's love, "If you had one hundred sheep, 
and one of them strayed away and was lost in the wilderness, wouldn't you leave the ninety-nine 
others and go and search for the lost one until you found it? (Lk. 15:4)

Our Lesson for Today:
We may be able to understand a God who would forgive sinners who come to Him 
for mercy. But a God who tenderly searches for sinners and then joyfully forgives them
must possess an extraordinary love!

This is the kind of love that prompted Jesus to come to earth to search for lost people
and save them. This is the kind of extraordinary love that God has for you. If you feel
far from God, don't despair. He is searching for you...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You Lord for the love that found me when I was not
searching for You...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

May we ever be mindful of Your relentless care and find comfort in the knowledge that You will never stop searching for us. Amen.

04/13/2010~~~food for thought~~~MY GUIDE AND PROTECTOR...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
He makes me to lie down in green pastures, He leads me 
beside still waters. (Ps. 23:2)

Our Lesson for Today:
When and if we allow God, our Shepherd, to guide us, we will have contentment.
When we choose to sin and go our own way, we cannot blame God for the environment 
we create for ourselves...

Our Shepherd knows the "green meadows" and "peaceful streams" that will restore
us. We can only reach these place by obediently following Him. (Think about this) ~
rebelling against the Shepherd's leading is actually rebelling against our own best interests.
Let us remember this the next time we are tempted to go our own way rather than the
Shepherds way...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to say, "The Lord is my Shepherd.
that's all I want." ~ Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

04/14/2010~~~food for thought~~~LET THE SHEPHERD LEAD...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Surely goodness and love will follow me all the days of my life,
and I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever...(Ps. 23:6)

Our Lesson for Today:
Did you notice how David viewed the future? He spoke not in years, but days.
Day by day he saw God's goodness and mercy following him. Actually, the Hebrew
word he used for "follow" was much stronger. It meant to pursue, to chase after,
catch up to, and clutch him...

With goodness David referred to his shepherd taking care of his bodily needs.
With love he pointed to the Shepherd's abiding love that provided forgiveness
and strength for his soul. ~ Though David didn't know what the future held for
him, he knew who held the future. ~ Wherever his Good Shepherd led, he could 
safely follow...

So can I. Even when my last moment comes, I can follow His leading to the Father's 
house above. There I will be home forever with Him...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, surround me with Your goodness and mercy
each day till you take me home, to be with You forever...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

04/15/2010~~~food for thought~~~JUDGEMENT DAY TODAY...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
There is no judgment awaiting those who trust in Him. But those who
do not trust in Him have already been judged for not believing in the 
Son of God...(Jn. 3:18)

Our Lesson for Today:
Judgment day ~ that's what some call April 15. Today's the last day to file
our taxes without penalty. Some pay ahead of time; others petition for an
extension. But sooner or later, we have to pay up...

Afraid of Judgment day? Not when God's grace has brought me to faith in His
one and only Son. Those who know Jesus as their only Savior have already been 
judged. They have been declared free from sin and fit for heaven...

Jesus' blood and righteousness are their beauty and glorious dress.
"Come, inherit the kingdom prepared for you," will be His welcome to believers
at the moment of their death and on the last day...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, please hear me for Your mercy's sake...Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Jesus told Martha, "I am the resurrection and the life. Those who believe in Me, 
even though they die like everyone else, will live again...(Jn. 11:25)

Our Lesson for Today:
Let us never forget Jesus has power over life and death as well as power to forgive sins.
How is this so? It is because He is the Creator of life (Jn. 14:6). He who is life surely can 
restore life...

Whoever believes in Christ has a spiritual life that death cannot conquer or diminish in any way.
When we realize His power and how wonderful His offer to us is, how can we not commit our 
lives to Him? To us who believe, what a wonderful assurance and certainty we have: "I will
live again, and you will too" (Jn. 14:19)

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Risen Savior, remind me as I travel toward death that You
are my resurrection and life...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

04/17/2010~~~food for thought~~~FOCUS ON CHRIST'S GOAL...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I hope all of you who are mature Christians will agree on these things.
If you disagree on some point, I believe God will make it plain to you.
But we must be sure to obey the truth we have learned already...(Phil. 3:15, 16)

Our Lesson for Today:
Sometimes trying to live a perfect Christian life can be so difficult that it
leaves us drained and discouraged. We may feel so far from perfect that
we think we can never please God with our life. ~ Paul used perfection (3:12)
to mean mature or complete not flawless in every detail...

Those who are mature should press on in the Holy Spirit's power, knowing 
that Christ will reveal and fill any differences between what we are and what 
we should be. ~ Christ's provision is no excuse for lagging devotion, but
it provides relief and assurance for those who feel driven...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to keep working toward that day when
I will be all that Christ Jesus saved me for and wants me to 
be...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Fill us with the power of Your Holy Spirit, that we may press on toward maturity, resting in the assurance of Your grace and the freedom found in Jesus. May we walk in the path You have set before us, confident that You will reveal and fill any gaps between who we are and who we should be. Amen.

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Words from Jesus ~ "All those who want to be My disciples must come and follow Me,
because My servants must be where I am. And if they follow Me, the Father will honor 
them. (Jn. 12:26)

Our Lesson for Today:
Many in Jesus' day believed that He came for the Jews only. But when Jesus said, "All
those who want to be my disciples must come and follow me," He was also talking to 
these Greeks as well...

No matter who the sincere seekers are, Jesus welcomes them. His message is for everyone.
Let us not allow social or racial differences to become barriers to the Good News. Let us
remember to share the Good News with all people...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to remove all prejudice from my life,
that I may pray sincerely for all people, including those who
would seek to do me harm...Amen.

04/19/2010~~~food for thought~~~WILLING TO BE COUNTED...

Our Bible Verses for today:
Obey the government, for God is the one who put it there. All governments
have been placed in power by God...(Ro. 13:1) ~ also check out (Ps. 75).
I was challenged by a dear friend to read these verses. I'm so thankful for her...

Our lesson for Today:
Are there times when we should not obey the government? Yes?
We should never allow the government to force us to disobey God.

Jesus and His apostles never disobeyed the government for personal reasons:
But when they did disobey, it was in order to follow God's moral standards.

Their disobedience was not cheap: They were threatened, beaten, thrown into jail, 
tortured, and executed for their convictions.

Like them, if we are compelled to disobey, we must be ready to accept the consequences...

I'm inclined to believe the day is coming when we as Christians, will have to stand up
and be counted... Let us remember to pray that we will be strong enough to remain faithful.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to remain faithful during the trials that
are coming. Help all of Jesus' people to be willing to be 
counted for Him...Amen. 

Please remember Jesus said "I am the way, the truth, and the life."
No one comes to the Father accept by me."

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Let us remember to pray that we will be strong enough to remain faithful.

Grant us the wisdom and courage to follow Your moral standards, even when it means facing consequences for our convictions, as Your Son and the apostles did (Romans 13:1). May we be strengthened by Your Spirit to remain faithful, come what may. We pray this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.

04/20/2010~~~food for thought~~~REAL PEACE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus said, "Peace I leave with you: My peace I give to you. 
I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts
be troubled and do not be afraid."...(Jn. 14:27)

Our Lesson for Today:
There is very little real peace in the world today with all that is happening.
We have wars and rumors of wars, earth quakes and volcanoes erupting,
floods, tornadoes, financial melt downs, families loosing their homes, and
their jobs, and scary decisions made by our Government, just to name a
few things that cause us worry...

But unlike worldly peace, which is usually defined as the absence of conflict,

If your life is full of stress, allow the Holy Spirit to fill you with Christ's peace.
Read Phil. 4:6, 7 for more on experiencing God's peace...

Dear Lord, through Your Word remind me constantly of Your
forgiveness so that I have peace...Amen.

But unlike worldly peace, which is usually defined as the absence of conflict, with Christ's peace, we have no need to fear the present or the future. Our Bible Verse for Today:
How great is the love the Father has lavished on us, that we should
be called children of God! ~ And that is what we are! (I Jn. 3:1)

Our Lesson for Today:
We have different occupations ~ live in different locations, But one name covers us
all."Children of God," John calls us, members of God's family ~ heirs of His heaven.
But let us never forget, that's not what we were by nature."We were by nature object of wrath,"
(Eph. 2:3 tells us)

How in the world could such a transformation take place? John excitedly tells us, 
"It was by the love the Father lavished on us." God's amazing love did the impossible to me...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, keep me excited till I can praise You in heaven...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

He appears, we shall be like Him, for we shall see Him as He is...(I Jn. 3:2)

"We shall se Him as He is." John writes. With eyes of faith I see my Savior 
now in the pages of His Holy Word. ~ With the eyes of my heart, I have imagined 
what He looks like. ~

But in heaven I'll know. ~ In heaven I'll see Him face-to-face. What a sight that will
be ~ that first look at His spotless purity, His splendid power, and especially His
saving grace...

And that sight will be for all those who have become His children through His
great love...

Thank You Lord, for making me your child through Jesus.
Keep me as Your child forever...Amen
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

04/23/2010~~~food for thought~~~REMEMBER JESUS CHRIST...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, descend from David... (2 Tm. 2:8)

Our Lesson for Today:
"Remember Jesus Christ raised from the dead," Paul wrote. In these words
we see our Savior's Godforsakenness because of our sin's burden. In these 
words we see tender hands take Him from the cross and deposit Him in the 
tomb. And then on Easter we see His triumphant resurrection, ~ God's stamp
of approval on all that His Son had done. ~

Yes, remember Jesus Christ raised from the dead. ~ My sins are gone. ~ 
My grave will open. ~ Heaven is my real home...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, let me always remember Jesus so that I
can share heaven's hereafter with Him...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Through His death and resurrection, we have been buried with Him and raised to new life, assured of our eternal home in Heaven. May we ever hold fast to this glorious truth, rejoicing in the salvation You have freely given us. Amen.

04/24/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE MOST WONDERFUL SEED EVER PLANTED...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus Himself said: "The truth is, a kernel of wheat must be planted in the soil.
Unless it dies it will be alone ~ a single seed, but its death will produce many 
new kernels ~ A plentiful harvest of new lives." (Jn 12:24)

Our Lesson for Today:
This is a beautiful picture of the necessary sacrifice of Jesus. Unless a kernel of 
wheat is planted in the soil, it will not become a blade of wheat producing more seeds.

So, Jesus really had to die to pay the penalty for our sins, but also to show His
power over death...

His resurrection proves He has eternal life. ~ Because Jesus is God, Jesus can 
give this same eternal life to all who believe in Him...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, make and keep me one of those kernels 
reserved for heaven by Your death...Amen

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

So, Jesus really had to die to pay the penalty for our sins, but also to show His power over death. His resurrection proves He has eternal life. ~ Because Jesus is God, Jesus can give this same eternal life to all who believe in Him.
original_verse_text: Jesus Himself said: "The truth is, a kernel of wheat must be planted in the soil. Unless it dies it will be alone ~ a single seed, but its death will produce many new kernels ~ A plentiful harvest of new lives."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who willingly laid down His life to pay the penalty for our sins. Just as a kernel of wheat must die to bear much fruit, so too did Jesus die and rise again, conquering death and granting us the promise of eternal life. May we trust in His finished work on the cross and receive the gift of salvation, for the wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord. Amen.

So, Jesus really had to die to pay the penalty for our sins, but also to show His power over death. His resurrection proves He has eternal life. Because Jesus is God, Jesus can give this same eternal life to all who believe in Him.

04/28/2010~~~food for thought~~~WITHOUT HIM ~ NOTHING

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Apart from Me you can do nothing." (Jn. 15:5)

Our Lesson for Today:
Will we ever really learn ~~~ we keep trying to go it alone without Him
even though we have this warning ~~~ (Apart from me you can do nothing)

Jesus says, that the only way to live a good life, is to stay close to Him,
like a branch attached to the vine. Yes apart from Him our efforts are
unfruitful...

Have you been receiving the nourishment and life offered by Christ, the vine?
If not, you have been missing the specail gift He has for you...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, through the power of Your gospel, keep me
connected to You and fruitful...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Yes apart from Him our efforts are unfruitful. Have you been receiving the nourishment and life offered by Christ, the vine? If not, you have been missing the specail gift He has for you.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we confess that we often try to navigate life's challenges on our own, forgetting that apart from You, we can do nothing. Forgive us for our self-reliance and independence. Lord, help us to abide in You, the true Vine, that we may bear much fruit for Your glory. Fill us with Your strength and power, that we may do all things through Christ who strengthens us. May we remain steadfast in our connection to You, the source of our life and sustenance. Amen.

04/30/2010~~~food for thought~~~ARE YOU TRULY CONNECTED...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
If anyone does not remain in Me, he is like a branch that is thrown away and withers; 
such branches are picked up, thrown into the fire and burned...(Jn. 15:6)

Our Lesson for Today:
Can't you almost see the heavenly gardener at work? Carefully He checks each branch.
One appears to be dying, but He doesn't saw it off at once. Patiently He waits and tries
repairing it. ~ But finally the last trace of life is gone, and He saws off the dead branch.
and into the fire it goes...

Look carefully though, how Jesus describes those dead branches. ~ He doesn't say, 
"If anyone has no fruit," ~ but "If anyone does not remain in Me." ~ the lack of connection
with the Savior makes one a dead branch in the eyes of the heavenly gardener. ~ The 
dead branches are those in whose hearts is no faith in Christ... ~

Remember He who see the heart makes no mistakes ~ He know which branches are dead 
and saws accordingly. ~ How sad that brushfire in hell will be. ~ on the other hand, how
thankful I should be that God has grafted me in faith to Jesus and made me a living branch 
in the vine...

Prayer Suggestion:
Please, dear Lord, according to Your love and mercy,
always keep me connected...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

05/01/2010~~~food for thought~~~THIS I ASK IN JESUS' NAME...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I tell you the truth, My Father will give you whatever you ask in my name. (Jn. 16:23)

Our Lesson for Today:
Jesus is taking about a new relationship between believers and God. Previously, people 
had to approach God through priests. After Jesus' resurrection, any believer could approach 
God directly...

Yes a new day has dawned and now all believers are priests, talking with God personally and 
directly (Heb. 10:19-23). YES we can approach God, not because of our own merits, BUT
because Jesus, our great High Priest, has made us acceptable to God...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to remember to use the privilege all believers
have of calling on You in our Savior's name...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Jesus is taking about a new relationship between believers and God. Previously, people had to approach God through priests. After Jesus' resurrection, any believer could approach God directly. Yes a new day has dawned and now all believers are priests, talking with God personally and directly (Hebrews 10:19-23). YES we can approach God, not because of our own merits, BUT because Jesus, our great High Priest, has made us acceptable to God.
original_verse_text: I tell you the truth, My Father will give you whatever you ask in my name.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, knowing that through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus, we have been granted the privilege to approach Your throne of grace with confidence (Hebrews 4:16). We no longer need to rely on earthly priests, for Christ has made us a royal priesthood, able to commune with You directly (1 Peter 2:9). Lord, we praise You for this new and living way, and we ask that You would continue to draw us near, that we may find mercy and grace to help us in our time of need. Amen.
reflection: Jesus is talking about a new relationship between believers and God. Previously, people had to approach God through priests. After Jesus' resurrection, any believer could approach God directly. Yes, a new day has dawned, and now all believers are priests, talking with God personally and directly (Hebrews 10:19-23). Yes, we can approach God, not because of our own merits, but because Jesus, our great High Priest, has made us acceptable to God.
